name: NPR
text:
Colleges across the U.S. are worried about coronavirus outbreaks in the fall. Their plans to prevent the spread all rely on one thing: students following the rules.

But some experts fear that's too big of a risk.
https://t.co/90z9OpGzD6

name: NPR
text:
Statues of Christopher Columbus are being toppled or removed across the country. Now, that movement is playing out in Columbus, Ohio â€” the city named for him.

name: NPR
text:
Reddit has banned the subreddit "The_Donald," a forum for President Trump fans with nearly 800,000 users, saying it repeatedly violated the platform's rules against harassment, hate speech and content manipulation.
https://t.co/FJweRdbp6n

name: NPR
text:
Patience and Fortitude, the marble lions perched outside the New York Public Library, have been given face coverings â€” a reminder to New Yorkers to follow COVID-19 safety guidelines.
https://t.co/VijsR8ilcZ

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Mitch McConnell: "We must have no stigma, none, about wearing masks when we leave our homes and come near other people. Wearing simple face coverings is not about protecting ourselves. It is about protecting everyone we encounter."
https://t.co/Pa3HYXCv4L

name: NPR
text:
Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey has ordered bars, gyms, movie theaters and water parks to shut down for at least 30 days amid thousands of new coronavirus cases in the state.
https://t.co/UEKdj66ofB

name: NPR
text:
Mississippi lawmakers on Sunday voted to retire the state's flag with the Confederate battle emblem in the corner, which has flown since 1894. "It was a very hateful oppressive and divisive symbol," says Sen. Derrick Simmons.
https://t.co/Gks1osqkKl
